title: Project-Based Understanding of Mathematical Division for Real-World Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication)
context.additional_context: Division education integrated with social studies in vocational training institutions, structured as PBL using real-life problem scenarios; smartphones are restricted to use as learning tools only

learning_goals: They can apply division concepts to solve real-life problems (e.g., budget allocation, material division) and propose solutions.
Using anchored scenarios, learners can distinguish and explain the meanings of quotient and remainder in division contextually.
Through collaborative problem-solving (e.g., multi-step division), learners enhance mathematical communication skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
